etymologies: late 18th century: from Latin accret- ‘grown’, from the verb accrescere, from ad- ‘to’ + crescere ‘grow’

examples.text: ice that had accreted grotesquely into stalactites

definitions: form (a composite whole or a collection of things) by gradual accumulation

examples.text: the collection of art he had accreted was to be sold

shortDefinitions: form composite whole by gradual accumulation

definitions: (with reference to matter or a body) come or bring together under the influence of gravitation

examples.text: the gas will cool and then accrete to the galaxy's core

shortDefinitions: (of matter or body) come or bring together under influence of gravitation
